intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods, which resemble a purse, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and has alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The flowers are small and yellow, with four petals, and bloom in early spring.
